thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Tuesday, 17 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: U.S. would like to see free trade deal with Japan: White House adviser

author: Reuters Editorial
title: U.S. would like to see free trade deal with Japan: White House adviser
text:
WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (Reuters) - White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Tuesday the United States would like to see a free trade deal with Japan at some point, noting the two countries had some differences on trade.
U.S. President Donald Trump's top economic adviser Larry Kudlow is interviewed at the White House in Washington. U.S., April 6, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque “We have certain disagreements with respect to some of the trading issues. We’ll iron those out hopefully,” Kudlow told reporters during a briefing ahead of a meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.
“The United States would probably like to see a free trade agreement come out at some point with Japan,” he said.
Reporting by Steve Holland; Writing by David Alexander; Editing by Tim Ahmann
